alert.note: Alert for Merced (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 9:38AM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Stevinson affecting Merced County. For the Merced River...including Stevinson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Stevinson. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 70.5 feet, Water is up to the maintenance building in Hagaman Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PDT Sunday, April 09 the stage was 71.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM PDT Sunday was 71.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 71.2 feet by 3:00 AM PDT Wednesday the 12th of April. - Flood stage is 71.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 71.4 feet on 03/21/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM PDT.
